meanings.meaning: 1. like; similar to; same as See also 如し
如 【こと】、如 【もころ】、若 【もころ】
こと: Out-dated or obsolete kana usage. もころ: Out-dated or obsolete kana usage. もころ: Out-dated or obsolete kana usage.
1. tathata (the ultimate nature of all things) Buddhism, See also 真如
1. how; in what way; by what means Usually written using kana alone, See also どうやってそのニュースはどうして漏れたのだろう。How did the news get out?
2. why; for what reason; for what purpose; what for Usually written using kana aloneどうしてあなたにお詫びする理由があるのですか。Why should I apologize to you?
4. no way Usually written using kana alone, often as どうして、どうして
如何して: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. how; in what way; by what means Usually written using kana alone, See also どうやってそのニュースはどうして漏れたのだろう。How did the news get out?
2. why; for what reason; for what purpose; what for Usually written using kana aloneどうしてあなたにお詫びする理由があるのですか。Why should I apologize to you?
4. no way Usually written using kana alone, often as どうして、どうして
如何して: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: How did the news get out?
Why should I apologize to you?

meanings.meaning: 1. by all means; at any cost; no matter what; at any rate; surely Usually written using kana alone彼女はどうしても自分の思い通りにしようとする。She will have her own way.
2. whether (one is) willing or not; willingly or unwillingly; willy-nilly Usually written using kana alone
3. on no account; by no means Usually written using kana alone, with. neg. verb残念ですが、あなたの名前をどうしても覚えられない。I'm sorry to say I don't remember your name.
4. in the end; in the long run; after all; eventually Usually written using kana aloneその計画を成功させるためには君の援助がどうしても必要だ。Your help is indispensable for the success of the scheme.
如何しても: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. by all means; at any cost; no matter what; at any rate; surely Usually written using kana alone彼女はどうしても自分の思い通りにしようとする。She will have her own way.
2. whether (one is) willing or not; willingly or unwillingly; willy-nilly Usually written using kana alone
3. on no account; by no means Usually written using kana alone, with. neg. verb残念ですが、あなたの名前をどうしても覚えられない。I'm sorry to say I don't remember your name.
4. in the end; in the long run; after all; eventually Usually written using kana aloneその計画を成功させるためには君の援助がどうしても必要だ。Your help is indispensable for the success of the scheme.
如何しても: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: She will have her own way.
I'm sorry to say I don't remember your name.
Your help is indispensable for the success of the scheme.

meanings.meaning: 1. how; in what way Usually written using kana alone環境汚染にいかに取り組むかは深刻な問題である。How to deal with environmental pollution is a serious matter.
2. how (much); to what extent Usually written using kana alone私は教育がいかに重要であるかを痛感しました。It was brought home to me how important education is.
4. hey; oi Archaic
1. how; in what way Usually written using kana alone環境汚染にいかに取り組むかは深刻な問題である。How to deal with environmental pollution is a serious matter.
2. how (much); to what extent Usually written using kana alone私は教育がいかに重要であるかを痛感しました。It was brought home to me how important education is.
4. hey; oi Archaic

sentences.translation: How to deal with environmental pollution is a serious matter.
It was brought home to me how important education is.
Institutions, however noble their missions, have failed to replace the family.

meanings.meaning: 1. indeed; really; truly; just (like) Usually written using kana alone, indicating emotive convictionこんな格好をしているといかにもスポーツしてそうに見えるけど、全然やってないんだよ。I look for all the world like an athlete in this outfit, but the truth is I don't do any sports at all.
2. very; extremely; totally; terribly Usually written using kana alone
3. absolutely; certainly; for sure Usually written using kana alone, indicating agreement

1. indeed; really; truly; just (like) Usually written using kana alone, indicating emotive convictionこんな格好をしているといかにもスポーツしてそうに見えるけど、全然やってないんだよ。I look for all the world like an athlete in this outfit, but the truth is I don't do any sports at all.
2. very; extremely; totally; terribly Usually written using kana alone
3. absolutely; certainly; for sure Usually written using kana alone, indicating agreement

sentences.translation: I look for all the world like an athlete in this outfit, but the truth is I don't do any sports at all.

2. surely; absolutely; certainly; indeed Usually written using kana alone, Only applies to いかさま
いか様 【いかさま】、イカサマ

meanings.type: Noun, Noun which may take the genitive case particle 'no', Na-adjective (keiyodoshi)
meanings.meaning: 1. fraud; cheating; foul play; trickery; hoax; swindle; counterfeit; fake Usually written using kana alone, See also いんちき
2. surely; absolutely; certainly; indeed Usually written using kana alone, Only applies to いかさま
いか様 【いかさま】、イカサマ
1. suspicious; dubious; unreliable Usually written using kana aloneあの宗教団体はかなりいかがわしい教義にとりつかれている。That religious cult has got some pretty off the wall ideas.
2. indecent; unseemly Usually written using kana alone学生たるものはいかがわしい場所にちかづかない方がよい。Students are expected to stay away from dubious places.
1. suspicious; dubious; unreliable Usually written using kana aloneあの宗教団体はかなりいかがわしい教義にとりつかれている。That religious cult has got some pretty off the wall ideas.
2. indecent; unseemly Usually written using kana alone学生たるものはいかがわしい場所にちかづかない方がよい。Students are expected to stay away from dubious places.

sentence: しゅうきょうだんたい
sentences.translation: That religious cult has got some pretty off the wall ideas.
Students are expected to stay away from dubious places.

1. what kind of; whatever sort of Usually written using kana alone
2. no matter what; however much おやおや。いかな体育の授業といえど・・・真剣勝負の意気込みで臨まなければ、いざ実戦と言う時に役に立ちませんよ。Well, even if it is just P.E. class, if you don't take it seriously, it won't do you any good in a real match.
如何な 【いっかな】

sentences.translation: Well, even if it is just P.E. class, if you don't take it seriously, it won't do you any good in a real match.

meanings.meaning: 1. being inferior to; being no match for See also 百聞は一見に如かず, Antonym: 如く しく
2. being best See also 三十六計逃げるに如かず
若かず 【しかず】、及かず 【しかず】
1. being inferior to; being no match for See also 百聞は一見に如かず, Antonym: 如く しく
2. being best See also 三十六計逃げるに如かず

1. you're welcome; don't mention it; not at all; my pleasure Usually written using kana alone
如何致しまして 【どういたしまして】
如何致しまして: Rarely-used kanji form.
1. please; if you would; would you mind Polite (teineigo) language, Usually written using kana alone, See also どうぞどうかドアを閉めてくれませんか。Will you please shut the door?
2. somehow or other; one way or another Usually written using kana alone
3. whether (or not); if Usually written using kana alone, See also かどうか, as かどうか
4. strange; (something is) wrong; (something is) off Usually written using kana alone
如何か: Rarely-used kanji form.

sentences.translation: Will you please shut the door?

1. how; in what way; I wonder Usually written using kana alone, See also 如何 どう, emphaticどこをどう考えたら、俺がロボット工学に明るいなどと思うんだろうか。Where did you come up with the idea that I'm familiar with robotics and such I wonder?

sentences.translation: Where did you come up with the idea that I'm familiar with robotics and such I wonder?
